Breakfast.title: Scrambled Eggs with Spinach and Feta
Breakfast.description: Scrambled eggs cooked with fresh spinach and tangy feta cheese, served with whole grain toast.
Breakfast.preparation:
1. In a bowl, whisk together eggs, salt, and pepper.
2. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add the egg mixture.
3. Cook, stirring occasionally, until eggs are almost set.
4. Add chopped spinach and feta cheese to the skillet and cook until spinach wilts and eggs are fully set.
5. Serve scrambled eggs with toasted whole grain bread.

Breakfast.title: Greek Yogurt Parfait with Berries
Breakfast.description: Layers of creamy Greek yogurt, granola, and fresh berries, drizzled with honey.
Breakfast.preparation:
1. In a glass or bowl, layer Greek yogurt, granola, and mixed berries.
2. Drizzle honey over the top.
3. Repeat layers if desired.
4. Serve immediately.

Breakfast.title: Banana Oatmeal Pancakes
Breakfast.description: Fluffy pancakes made with mashed bananas and oats, served with maple syrup.
Breakfast.preparation:
1. In a blender, combine mashed banana, oats, milk, egg, vanilla extract, and baking powder.
2. Blend until smooth.
3. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease with cooking spray.
4. Pour pancake batter onto the skillet to form pancakes.
5. Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown.
6. Serve hot with maple syrup.

Breakfast.title: Vegetable Frittata
Breakfast.description: A hearty egg dish loaded with sautéed vegetables and cheese, perfect for a satisfying breakfast.
Breakfast.preparation:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a bowl, whisk together eggs, salt, and pepper.
3. Heat an oven-safe skillet over medium heat and add a bit of oil.
4. Sauté bell pepper and mushrooms until tender, then add spinach and cook until wilted.
5. Pour the egg mixture over the vegetables in the skillet.
6. Sprinkle shredded cheese on top.
7. Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 15-20 minutes or until the frittata is set and golden brown.
8. Slice and serve hot.

Breakfast.title: Blueberry Banana Smoothie Bowl
Breakfast.description: A thick and creamy smoothie bowl made with ripe bananas, sweet blueberries, and creamy yogurt, topped with crunchy granola and fresh fruit.
ingredients: 1/4 cup almond milk (or any milk of choice)
Toppings: granola, sliced bananas, fresh blueberries
Breakfast.preparation:
1. In a blender, combine bananas, blueberries, Greek yogurt, almond milk, and honey (if using).
2. Blend until smooth and creamy.
3. Pour the smoothie into a bowl.
4. Top with granola, sliced bananas, and fresh blueberries.
5. Serve immediately with a spoon.

Lunch.title: Caprese Salad
Lunch.description: A refreshing salad made with ripe tomatoes, fresh mozzarella cheese, basil leaves, drizzled with balsamic glaze.
Lunch.preparation:
1. Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on a serving platter.
2. Tuck basil leaves between the tomato and cheese slices.
3. Drizzle with balsamic glaze.
4. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Serve immediately.

Lunch.title: Quinoa Salad with Chickpeas and Avocado
Lunch.description: A protein-packed salad featuring fluffy quinoa, creamy avocado, and fiber-rich chickpeas, tossed in a tangy vinaigrette.
Lunch.preparation:
1. In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, chickpeas, avocado, cherry tomatoes, red onion, and parsley.
2. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
3. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss until everything is well coated.
4. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Lunch.title: Mediterranean Veggie Wrap
Lunch.description: A flavorful wrap filled with hummus, roasted vegetables, feta cheese, and olives, wrapped in a soft tortilla.
ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed roasted vegetables (zucchini, bell peppers, eggplant)
Lunch.preparation:
1. Spread hummus evenly over the whole wheat tortilla.
2. Layer roasted vegetables, crumbled feta cheese, olives, and baby spinach leaves on top of the hummus.
3. Roll up the tortilla tightly, tucking in the sides as you go.
4. Cut the wrap in half diagonally and serve immediately.

Lunch.title: Minestrone Soup
Lunch.description: A hearty Italian soup made with vegetables, beans, pasta, and savory broth, perfect for a comforting lunch.
ingredients: 1 can cannellini beans, drained and rinsed
1 cup small pasta (such as ditalini or small shells)
Lunch.preparation:
1. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. Add diced onion, carrots, celery, and garlic. Cook until vegetables are softened.
3. Stir in diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, cannellini beans, and pasta.
4. Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until pasta is cooked and vegetables are tender.
5. Stir in chopped spinach and cook until wilted.
6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Serve hot with grated parmesan cheese on top.

Lunch.title: Grilled Chicken Caesar Wrap
Lunch.description: A handheld version of the classic Caesar salad, featuring grilled chicken, crisp romaine lettuce, parmesan cheese, and creamy Caesar dressing, wrapped in a flour tortilla.
Lunch.preparation:
1. Lay the flour tortilla flat on a clean surface.
2. Arrange sliced grilled chicken breast, chopped romaine lettuce, grated parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing down the center of the tortilla.
3. Fold in the sides of the tortilla, then roll it up tightly from the bottom.
4. Cut the wrap in half diagonally and serve immediately.

Dinner.title: Baked Salmon with Asparagus
Dinner.description: Flaky salmon fillets seasoned with herbs and lemon, baked alongside tender asparagus spears for a simple yet elegant meal.
Dinner.preparation:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. Place salmon fillets on one side of the baking sheet and arrange asparagus spears on the other side.
3. Drizzle olive oil over salmon and asparagus. Sprinkle minced garlic, dried thyme, and dried rosemary over the top.
4. Place lemon slices on top of the salmon fillets.
5. Season everything with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until salmon is cooked through and asparagus is tender.
7. Serve hot.

Dinner.title: Spaghetti Carbonara
Dinner.description: A classic Italian pasta dish featuring spaghetti tossed with crispy pancetta, creamy egg sauce, and grated parmesan cheese.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Dinner.preparation:
1. Cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup of pasta cooking water, then drain the spaghetti.
2. In a large skillet, cook diced pancetta over medium heat until crispy. Add minced garlic and cook for another minute.
3. In a bowl, whisk together eggs and grated parmesan cheese. Season with salt and black pepper.
4. Add cooked spaghetti to the skillet with the pancetta. Remove from heat.
5. Quickly pour the egg and cheese mixture over the hot spaghetti, tossing constantly to coat the pasta evenly. If the sauce is too thick, add a little pasta cooking water to loosen it.
6. Serve immediately, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.

Dinner.title: Teriyaki Chicken Stir-Fry
Dinner.description: Tender chicken breast strips stir-fried with colorful vegetables in a sweet and savory teriyaki sauce, served over steamed rice.
Dinner.preparation:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together teriyaki sauce, soy sauce, honey, and cornstarch. Set aside.
2. Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add sliced chicken breast and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove from skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add a little more oil if needed. Add bell pepper, broccoli, carrot, mushrooms, and minced garlic. Stir-fry until vegetables are tender-crisp.
4. Return cooked chicken to the skillet. Pour the teriyaki sauce mixture over the chicken and vegetables.
5. Cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens and coats everything evenly.
6. Serve hot over cooked rice.

Dinner.title: Vegetarian Chili
Dinner.description: A hearty chili made with a variety of beans, tomatoes, and vegetables, flavored with chili powder and spices.
ingredients: 2 cans mixed beans (such as kidney beans, black beans, and pinto beans), drained and rinsed
Dinner.preparation:
1. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add chopped onion and minced garlic. Cook until softened.
2. Add chopped bell pepper, diced zucchini, and corn kernels. Cook until vegetables are tender.
3. Stir in diced tomatoes, mixed beans, vegetable broth, chili powder, ground cumin, and paprika.
4. Bring the chili to a simmer, then reduce heat and let it cook for about 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Serve hot, garnished with chopped fresh cilantro.

Dinner.title: Eggplant Parmesan
Dinner.description: Layers of crispy breaded eggplant slices, marinara sauce, and melted mozzarella cheese, baked to perfection.
Dinner.preparation:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a baking dish with olive oil.
2. In one shallow dish, combine breadcrumbs and grated parmesan cheese. In another shallow dish, place beaten eggs.
3. Dip eggplant slices into the beaten eggs, then coat with breadcrumb mixture.
4. Arrange breaded eggplant slices in a single layer in the prepared baking dish.
5. Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until eggplant is tender and breadcrumbs are golden brown.
6. Remove from the oven and spoon marinara sauce over the baked eggplant slices. Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese on top.
7. Return to the oven and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving.

Snacks.title: Greek Yogurt Parfait
Snacks.description: A protein-packed snack featuring creamy Greek yogurt layered with fresh berries and crunchy granola, perfect for refueling after a workout.
ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, and raspberries)
Snacks.preparation:
1. In a serving glass or bowl, layer Greek yogurt, mixed berries, and granola.
2. Repeat the layers until the glass or bowl is filled.
3. Serve immediately and enjoy!

Snacks.title: Protein Energy Balls
Snacks.description: Nutrient-dense energy balls made with oats, peanut butter, honey, and protein powder, providing a quick boost of energy and muscle-repairing protein.
ingredients: 1/4 cup protein powder (vanilla or chocolate flavored)
Snacks.preparation:
1. In a mixing bowl, combine rolled oats, peanut butter, honey, protein powder, and mini chocolate chips (if using).
2. Stir until well combined and the mixture holds together.
3. Roll the mixture into small balls, about 1 inch in diameter.
4. Place the energy balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
5. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to firm up.
6. Store the energy balls in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week.
7. Enjoy as a pre or post-workout snack!

Snacks.title: Cottage Cheese and Fruit Bowl
Snacks.description: A simple yet satisfying snack featuring creamy cottage cheese topped with fresh fruit slices and a drizzle of honey, rich in protein and vitamins.
ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed fruit slices (such as banana, apple, and kiwi)
Snacks.preparation:
1. In a serving bowl, place cottage cheese.
2. Top with mixed fruit slices.
3. Drizzle honey over the fruit.
4. Serve immediately and enjoy!

Snacks.title: Almond Butter Banana Toast
Snacks.description: A satisfying snack featuring whole grain toast spread with creamy almond butter and topped with sliced bananas, providing a balance of carbohydrates, healthy fats, and protein.
Snacks.preparation:
1. Spread almond butter evenly onto toasted whole grain bread.
2. Arrange sliced bananas on top of the almond butter.
3. Serve immediately and enjoy!

Snacks.title: Trail Mix
Snacks.description: A portable snack featuring a mix of nuts, seeds, dried fruits, and dark chocolate chips, providing a combination of healthy fats, fiber, and antioxidants.
Snacks.preparation:
1. In a bowl, combine almonds, cashews, pumpkin seeds, dried cranberries, and dark chocolate chips.
2. Mix well to evenly distribute ingredients.
3. Portion the trail mix into individual servings in small resealable bags or containers.
4. Enjoy as a convenient on-the-go snack!

Desserts.title: Chocolate Protein Mug Cake
Desserts.description: A quick and easy single-serving cake made with protein powder, cocoa powder, and almond flour, perfect for satisfying sweet cravings without derailing your fitness goals.
Desserts.preparation:
1. In a microwave-safe mug, whisk together chocolate protein powder, almond flour, cocoa powder, and baking powder.
2. Add egg, almond milk, and honey or maple syrup (if using). Mix until smooth.
3. Microwave on high for 1-2 minutes or until the cake is set.
4. Let cool slightly before enjoying.
5. Optionally, top with dark chocolate chips for extra indulgence.

Desserts.title: Banana Protein Ice Cream
Desserts.description: A creamy and guilt-free ice cream made with frozen bananas and protein powder, providing a satisfying treat packed with natural sweetness and muscle-repairing protein.
ingredients: 2 ripe bananas, peeled, sliced, and frozen
2 tablespoons almond milk or coconut milk
Desserts.preparation:
1. In a blender or food processor, combine frozen banana slices, vanilla protein powder, and almond milk.
2. Blend until smooth and creamy, scraping down the sides of the blender or food processor as needed.
3. Transfer the mixture to a freezer-safe container and freeze for 1-2 hours until firm.
4. Serve the banana protein ice cream in bowls and enjoy!

Desserts.title: Protein Peanut Butter Cups
Desserts.description: Homemade peanut butter cups made with dark chocolate and a protein-packed peanut butter filling, offering a healthier alternative to traditional candy while satisfying your sweet tooth.
Desserts.preparation:
1. Line a mini muffin tin with paper liners.
2. In a microwave-safe bowl, melt dark chocolate chips in 30-second intervals, stirring between each interval, until fully melted.
3. Spoon a small amount of melted chocolate into the bottom of each paper liner, spreading to cover the bottom.
4. In a separate bowl, mix together natural peanut butter, chocolate protein powder, almond flour, and honey or maple syrup until well combined.
5. Divide the peanut butter mixture evenly among the paper liners, pressing down gently to flatten.
6. Spoon the remaining melted chocolate over the peanut butter mixture, covering completely.
7. Place the muffin tin in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to set.
8. Once set, remove the peanut butter cups from the paper liners and enjoy!

Desserts.title: Berry Protein Popsicles
Desserts.description: Refreshing popsicles made with Greek yogurt, mixed berries, and protein powder, offering a cool and creamy treat packed with antioxidants and muscle-building protein.
ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, and raspberries)
Desserts.preparation:
1. In a blender, combine Greek yogurt, mixed berries, protein powder, and honey or maple syrup.
2. Blend until smooth and creamy.
3. Pour the mixture into popsicle molds, leaving a little space at the top for expansion.
4. Insert popsicle sticks into the molds.
5. Freeze for 4-6 hours or until firm.
6. Remove the popsicles from the molds and enjoy!

Desserts.title: Chocolate Avocado Mousse
Desserts.description: A rich and velvety mousse made with ripe avocados, cocoa powder, and a hint of sweetness from maple syrup, offering a decadent dessert packed with heart-healthy fats and antioxidants.
ingredients: 1/4 cup almond milk or coconut milk
Desserts.preparation:
1. In a blender or food processor, combine ripe avocados, cocoa powder, almond milk or coconut milk, maple syrup or honey, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt.
2. Blend until smooth and creamy, scraping down the sides of the blender or food processor as needed.
3. Transfer the mousse to serving glasses or bowls.
4. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.
5. Garnish with fresh berries or shaved dark chocolate if desired.
6. Enjoy the creamy and indulgent chocolate avocado mousse!

Supplementation.title: Chocolate Peanut Butter Protein Bars
Supplementation.description: Homemade protein bars packed with chocolatey goodness and peanut butter flavor, providing a convenient and delicious way to boost your protein intake on the go.
Supplementation.preparation:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine rolled oats, chocolate protein powder, cocoa powder, and chopped nuts.
2. In a saucepan, melt peanut butter and honey over low heat, stirring until smooth and well combined.
3. Pour the peanut butter mixture over the dry ingredients and mix until fully incorporated.
4. Press the mixture firmly into a lined baking dish and refrigerate for at least 2 hours until set.
5. Once set, cut into bars or squares.
6. Store the protein bars in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week.

Supplementation.title: Vanilla Almond Protein Shake
Supplementation.description: A creamy and satisfying protein shake made with vanilla protein powder, almond milk, and a hint of almond extract, perfect for post-workout recovery or as a quick meal replacement.
Supplementation.preparation:
1. In a blender, combine vanilla protein powder, almond milk, almond extract, and ice cubes.
2. Blend until smooth and creamy.
3. Pour the protein shake into a glass and enjoy immediately.

Supplementation.title: Mixed Berry Protein Smoothie
Supplementation.description: A refreshing and antioxidant-rich smoothie made with mixed berries, Greek yogurt, and protein powder, offering a delicious and nutritious way to refuel your body after a workout.
Supplementation.preparation:
1. In a blender, combine mixed berries, Greek yogurt, protein powder, honey or maple syrup, and ice cubes.
2. Blend until smooth and creamy.
3. Pour the smoothie into a glass and enjoy immediately.

Supplementation.title: Protein Energy Bites
Supplementation.description: No-bake energy bites made with oats, protein powder, nut butter, and honey, providing a quick and portable snack to keep you fueled throughout the day.
Supplementation.preparation:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine rolled oats, protein powder, chia seeds, mini chocolate chips, nut butter, honey, and vanilla extract.
2. Stir until well combined.
3. Roll the mixture into bite-sized balls.
4. Place the protein energy bites on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
5. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.
6. Store the energy bites in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week.

Supplementation.title: Chocolate Banana Protein Smoothie Bowl
Supplementation.description: A thick and creamy smoothie bowl made with chocolate protein powder, banana, almond milk, and spinach, topped with granola, sliced banana, and a drizzle of nut butter.
Supplementation.preparation:
1. In a blender, combine chocolate protein powder, banana, spinach, almond milk, and ice cubes.
2. Blend until smooth and creamy.
3. Pour the smoothie into a bowl.
4. Top with granola, sliced banana, and a drizzle of nut butter.
5. Enjoy the chocolatey goodness with a spoon!
